content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I executed the "google" command to search for "What is the statute of limitations for personal injury in New York?" and received multiple links. Then, I executed the "browse_website" command to search for the standard of proof in a personal injury case, but the website did not provide the information. Next, I executed the "google" command to search for "international law research resources". After that, I wrote the "average.py" file using the "write_to_file" command and received the message "File written to successfully." The file contains the "calculate_average" function. Then, I executed the "execute_python_file" command on "average.py" and received the message "The average of the numbers is: 3.0". Finally, I wrote a test file "test_average.py" using the "write_to_file" command and received the message "File written to successfully." The test file contains 3 test cases for the "calculate_average" function from the "average" module. All tests passed and the message "All tests passed!" was printed when I executed the "execute_python_file" command on "test_average.py".
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "international law research resources"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://law.gwu.libguides.com/PIL", "https://uow.libguides.com/law/international-law-resources", "https://research.un.org/az.php?s=1520", "https://guides.library.harvard.edu/law/fi-free", "https://www.law.nyu.edu/global/researchtools", "https://www.loc.gov/research-centers/law-library-of-congress/collections/digital-collections/foreign-law/", "https://www.law.nyu.edu/library/research/researchguides", "https://libguides.law.rutgers.edu/internationallaw"]', type='action_result')]
"""
